Package com.alyxferrari.jse3d.obj

Class Vector3

java.lang.Object
com.alyxferrari.jse3d.obj.Vector3
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Vector3
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
Represents a 3D vector.
Since:
2.2
Author:
Alyx Ferrari
See Also:
Serialized Form

    • movePosAbs

      public Vector3 movePosAbs​(double x, double y, double z, Display display)
      Moves this vector relative to (0,0,0).
      Parameters:
      x - Desired x value.
      y - Desired y value.
      z - Desired z value.
      display - The Display object being used to render this vector.
      Returns:
      The Vector3 on which this method was called.

    • movePosAbs

      public Vector3 movePosAbs​(double x, double y, double z, Vector3 camPos)
      Moves this vector relative to (0,0,0).
      Parameters:
      x - Desired x value.
      y - Desired y value.
      z - Desired z value.
      camPos - Position of the camera (result of Display.getCameraPosition(), not Display.getCameraPositionActual()).
      Returns:
      The Vector3 on which this method was called.

    • transitionPosAbs

      public Vector3 transitionPosAbs​(double x, double y, double z, int millis, Display display)
      Transitions this vector's position relative to (0,0,0) over a specified number of milliseconds.
      Parameters:
      x - Desired x value.
      y - Desired y value.
      z - Desired z value.
      millis - How many milliseconds it should take to transition this vector's position.
      display - The Display object being used to render this vector.
      Returns:
      The Vector3 on which this method was called.

    • transitionPosAbs

      public Vector3 transitionPosAbs​(double x, double y, double z, int millis, Vector3 camPos, int physicsTimestep)
      Transitions this vector's position relative to (0,0,0) over a specified number of milliseconds with a specified timestep.
      Parameters:
      x - Desired x value.
      y - Desired y value.
      z - Desired z value.
      millis - How many milliseconds it should take to transition this vector's position.
      camPos - Position of the camera (result of Display.getCameraPosition(), not Display.getCameraPositionActual()).
      physicsTimestep - The timestep that should be used to transition this vector's position.
      Returns:
      The Vector3 on which this method was called.
